text: - My name is Moe Alhassan.

I am a manager of Partner
Solutions Architecture.
I joined through an apprenticeship program
nearly four years ago.
I spent six months in that program.
It was oriented towards teaching people
all about solutions architecture.

I actually had no clue what
the job was when I joined
but I knew AWS was an interesting place
and I was excited about the challenge, so.
I guess in between the techie program

and then getting placed
into a full-time job,
you get a chance
to talk to a bunch of different teams

to kind of understand
where am I gonna be working
after this apprenticeship.
I have a management degree.

And to me, it was really
interesting hearing about

the partner work in particular
because it's a slightly,

I think, in my opinion, more
complex business environment.
So you're dealing with third party vendors

and it's a lot of business
to business to business,

so that's, I think, what
sparked the interest.
We're helping our partners

help our customers, which is
a very different, I guess,

model than other solutions
architecture positions.
So we have to think through how,
what the partner's gonna be doing,
is going to affect the end customer
and their end customer, too.

Just finished an
interview with a candidate
and it's for a candidate that I'm hiring.

So I get to choose the
leadership principles
that I'm assessing.

And my favorite two are Are
Right, A Lot and Earn Trust.
Are Right, A Lot, I think good judgment
and instincts are really important,

especially at AWS when
you are really autonomous

and encouraged to make
decisions on your own.

And then Earn Trust,
I think you have to be
someone who listens attentively
and speaks, you know, truth, sometimes

and also someone who can
just build good relationships

with people.
(upbeat music)
